actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Codes of 1954 to provide for the non-recognition of grain from the sale of stock in a domestic corporation engaged in a trade or business related to energy if within 90 days after the sale the proceeds are invested in stock of another such corporation.

summary.text: Freedom of Energy Investment Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide for the nonrecognition of gain from the sale of stock in a domestic corporation engaged in a trade or business related to energy if, within 90 days after the sale, the proceeds are invested in stock of another such company.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Codes of 1954 to provide for the non-recognition of grain from the sale of stock in a domestic corporation engaged in a trade or business related to energy if within 90 days after the sale the proceeds are invested in stock of another such corporation.
